summary: An email from Parvin Moyne of Akin Gump law firm to Thomas Moyer, flagging that Deutsche Bank has received information about an upcoming Wall Street Journal article regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The article will mention Epstein's control of a charity called Gratitude America, which held accounts at Deutsche Bank.

persons.name: Parvin Moyne
persons.role: Attorney at Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP
persons.context: Author of the email, notifying Deutsche Bank about an upcoming WSJ article mentioning Epstein and the bank.

persons.name: Thomas Moyer
persons.role: Recipient of the email (likely a Deutsche Bank representative)
persons.context: Primary recipient of the email notification about the upcoming WSJ article regarding Epstein and Deutsche Bank.

connections.description: Moyne is communicating with Moyer to provide advance notice about a news article involving Deutsche Bank and Epstein.

events.title: Wall Street Journal article publication
events.description: An article in the Wall Street Journal is reported to be published, mentioning Jeffrey Epstein, his control of charity Gratitude America, and its accounts at Deutsche Bank.

keyFacts: Deutsche Bank received advance information about an upcoming Wall Street Journal article related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The article reports that Jeffrey Epstein controlled a charity called Gratitude America.
The charity Gratitude America held accounts at Deutsche Bank.
The communication is from a law firm (Akin Gump) to a Deutsche Bank representative, indicating legal/financial advisory involvement.
